sentences.en: He faces trial on extortion charges.

sentences.en: He pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit extortion.
sentences.cn: 他供认了犯有合谋敲诈罪.

sentences.en: He was known for running a brutal extortion racket.
sentences.cn: 他因干过一起残忍的敲诈勒索而出名.

sentences.en: Many gangs collected protection in the form of extortion.

So Zhang and Liu had sprouted on the idea of extortion.

sentences.en: The sense of wrongs, the injustices, the oppression, extortion, and pillage of twenty years suddenly and found voice in a raucous howl of execration.

sentences.en: They were aggrieved by oppression and extortion.

sentences.en: Today, Rostov stands accused of extortion and racketeering.

sentences.en: Unscrupulous use of one's position to derive profit or advantages; extortion.
sentences.cn: 无耻地利用职位来取得利益或好处; 勒索,敲诈.

sentences.en: We can get him on extortion, but other than that, I got nothing.
sentences.cn: 我们顶多可以告他敲诈罪, 其它方面, 我没办法.

sentences.en: When my children say they will leave me in peace if I let them go to the pictures, it is little short of extortion.
sentences.cn: 我的孩子们说,除非我让他们去看电影,否则不让我安宁, 这和敲诈勒索没什么两样.
